Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - this is a MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: Based on the photos on the hotel site, I thought I was staying at a hotel. I checked in and was directed to another building on the property with exterior entry doors. They should call this a MOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, nice people eager to please. All the amenities a body could want when traveling. A bit on the pricy side but well worth it. We were there with the 801st Aviation Engineers group. We stayed 2 days, took my aunt to a show. We swam at nite and got into the hot tub. Had drinks in the pub. Continental breakfast consisted of a breakfast buffet at the restaurant next door. Sadie's has an entertainer come in a sing to the people as well as great food.

Reviews.Title: “No musty smell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: christy s
Reviews.Content: Don't you hate walking into a hotel, only to be met by musty odor? This seems to be a problem at many older hotels, but not here!!! Very clean also! We slept great and then had a buffet breakfast at the restaurant next door...just had to pay for drinks and tip! I was sooo relieved to not have to stand in line to make waffles for my kids like the usual complementary breakfasts!!! Indoor and outdoor pools and hot tubs also!!!! Great for the kids!!!! I would definitely stay again! Gave it a four only because there was no mirror in the "bathroom" and this made it difficult for me to get ready without waking up the kids....

Reviews.Title: “Great night of sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Dleep
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff was outstanding. All of them. We had a room with a balcony in the main building and it was very clean. The location was great if you want to be close to the action on highway 76. The biggest compliment came from my wife, who almost always has trouble sleeping in hotels. She told me this was the best night of sleep she has ever had at any hotel. Thanks for a great weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: Cancelled another hotel to stay here based on photos and reviews. Very Very misleading is the fact that behind this great front entrance is a old motel type hotel where most of the rooms are located. When you book you are not told this and would never have booked if this had been know. Too late to cancel since cancellation day was prior day to arrival. Very unhappy since there are so many other places to choose from. Also breakfast is a voucher to restaurant next door which includes buffet but you are charged for drinks and tip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it-with one exception.”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with everything about this hotel regarding great pool, free breakfast, clean room, friendly staff, comfortable beds, and value. I would just like people to be aware of the "ticket sale booth" in the front of Sadies Sideboard restaurant where you receive your free breakfast. We wanted to purchase some show tickets and thought you could possibly just buy them there for convienence. The first thing I asked to man is if there was a catch and do we have to attend a timeshare presentation. He said no, all you have to do is go to such and such place to pick up your tickets. Unfortunately I believed him and never read the receipt he folded and handed to my husband. After I read the fine print about sitting through a 90min presentation I was aggravated but decided well we are saving money. The 90 min presentation was really 2 hours. After the presentation a high pressure salesperson who was very rude and offensive sat with us and treated us terribly b/c we weren't interested. Please Clarion and all customers go online and read the terrible reviews about VSA-Vacation Services of America. I am disappointed that Clarion and Sadies would even be remotely associated with such a shady and deceptive business. Use expedia or travelocity if you are that desperate to save money on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that is centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: calgal405
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this hotel for our family reunion. We loved it! The rooms were nice, clean, and good-sized. The staff were lovely and quite accomodating. There were two pool (indoor & outdoor). We were at the outdoor pool every evening and loved it. It is huge ... with a separated (with buoy time line) area for the deeper area for adults and an extensive area for children or those who enjoy shallow depth. The hotel provides a free breakfast each day at the restaurant next door. Coffee, milk, and juice are all free. They do charge for sodas ... which we don't drink for breakfast anyway. I will stay here again anytime I come to Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zimfamily4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Clarion last year and re booked for this year. We love the rooms with the balconies and the outdoor pool. The beds are comfy and everything is very clean. Make sure if you book that you request the rooms with the balconies in the main building. The balconies aren't huge but two people can sit comfortably. The rooms come with a safe (not that we felt the need to use it in Branson), a microwave, and a mini refrigerator. The workers at the hotel are all very nice. A free breakfast buffet is included and it was okay, not great but certainly good enough for a free meal. It is next door at Sadie's which was okay. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But Not the Best...”
Reviews.Author: Jessica149
Reviews.Content: We were able to get this hotel at a discounted rate due to a friends and family discount. If we had paid full price I would really have been disappointed. We checked in on Thursday night and the staff checking us in seemed very occupied with something else. I had to ask questions like, "How do I get to my room?" Parking was also horrid. We had to park in front of the restaurant next door, Sadies, all 3 nights. We also found out how thin the walls were. We could hear the toilets flush in the rooms beside us... Also, someone went running through the halls and talking loudly almost all 3 nights we were there. Breakfast was good at Sadies next door (complimentary through the hotel). The pools were both very nice. The outdoor pool had a large 3-foot area perfect for our younger children to enjoy. However, I didn't enjoy the 1950s music so much while we were swimming. No music would have been fine. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. OH and I was really excited about the room with a balcony until I realized we were on the first floor. I really don't think we will be staying here again. We have stayed in nicer hotels for less money without a discount in the past. But, it's a great option for a clean place to stay if you don't mind too much noise and very little parking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time.”
Reviews.Author: Cindi L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and loved it. So I was excited to book early for this trip and get a discounted rate. However...I didn't realize that it meant we were staying "out back" in the "motel" portion of the place. The indoor pool was freezing, the beds were hard, the drinking glasses were filthy and the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, sending everyone out into the parking lot in their jammies. I don't know if it was prank or malfunction, but either way it added to my unhappiness with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest and relax.”
Reviews.Author: Majie2
Reviews.Content: We just happened to walk in on a Friday night late, the assistant gm waited on us, he was very friendly, was glade to show us a king suite, in which was awesome and yes we took it, beds are so comfy, our suite was great, and we had double balconies in which were large and cool to sit on in the am and watch the strip. We had two TV's and plenty of sitting areas. We will be back again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1mollyma
Reviews.Content: Family of four...boys 13 and 8....staff very helpful..room very clean and I am very picky...I looked at room before we stayed and looked at pool....the pool was big and cold and clean every day....we had room with balcony looking over pool...great price....complinentary breakfast at sadies was a full buffet ...awesome stay ....maintained grounds by staff best in Branson.! Thanks Clarion kids were even impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average, average, average.”
Reviews.Author: janer00
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Clarion and I thought the hotel to be just average, nothing special here. We had a king size room on the 6th floor with a view of the pool area. Every room has a balcony which is a nice addition, and there are two white plastic chairs on each one. The pool seems to be always open and I would encourage that if you are on this side of the hotel to get a room towards the top of the hotel. We could not hear any noise from the pool but I'm sure the lower rooms could be affected by this. The room is a good size, king size bed, 2 night-stands, a desk with a black leather desk chair and a good size arm chair. The room also has an entertainment center with a large flat screen tv and a fridge. The bathroom is small and extremely outdated. The sink and vanity are separated from the toilet and bathtub but the toilet/bathtub space is so tiny it is a tight fit getting in and out. There is maybe an inch of space where the door clears the toilet. This hotel also offers free breakfast at the buffet next door, Saddie's. The first day, this was fine. But having to endure this restaurant 2 more times was torture. There is no variety at the buffet, same thing everyday. Pancakes (that I think were made of rubber because I needed a knife to cut them...) biscuits and gravy, grits, oatmeal, bacon, sausage, ham, cereal and a selection of canned fruits. Nothing seemed homemade to me, tasted like everything was from a frozen bag or a can. It would be much nicer if there was a rotation of items. But I do need to add that the staff was always very helpful and courteous and were always working very hard. No slackers here. There is also live music, which is a nice touch, unless of course you want to talk to the people you are having breakfast with... The reason I say this hotel is just average because there really needs to be a remodel. The room just feels very dated. The vanity for example still has the older mini-fridge in it that is no longer working, that is just an eye sore. The wood is very dark and dated and just gives the general impression of many years of dirt and grime. You can really tell where the hotel has tried to make cosmetic changes, new tv and larger fridge in the newer entertainment cabinet, a curved shower curtain and I'm guessing a newer mattress because they were quite comfortable. You can tell because these small changes really stand out, but the rest is lack-luster.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: cupcake0512
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Breakfast was at the restraint next door and was awesome! Very clean and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Ozark hospitality at its best!”
Reviews.Author: tom108
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at this great hotel every summer when we come to Branson and when we stayed here recently we received the same great hospitality we have become accustomed to. A special thanks to Mrs. Betty and the A+ staff for making our stay a great one. This hotel is the best maintained property around. We have stayed in rooms throughout the hotel ( the suites are our favorite) and every room has been spotless. We stayed in a double queen this time with a balcony overlooking the pool, my kids loved that.The rooms are very modern and the beds are always very comfortable. The hotel has the cleanest pools and that is a must for us because our kids love to swim. This hotel has an indoor and outdoor pool as well as two hot tubs and are great places to relax after a long day of visiting Branson's attractions. The complimentary breakfast is now located at Sadies Sideboard and my family really enjoyed it, biscuits and gravy, bacon, country ham, sausage, pancakes, cereal, fruit, ect., if you leave hungry it is your own fault. Coffee and water is complimentary, my kids had small juices which are a dollar and is a bargain with such a great breakfast. There is also an entertainer at Sadies who sings country songs every morning which we really enjoyed . The hotel has many places on the property to relax and all the amenities you could want and is located in the center of the 76 strip and within walking distance to many attractions. The only two negatives would be that my kids love the hotel so much that its sometimes hard to get them to leave the hotel so we can tour Branson and when our vacation is over and we have to leave. Lastly, we lead such busy lives so we love to come to Branson and spend family time together and create memories and this hotel helps us do just that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Clarion Hotel with my family reunion. The staff was excellent and service was impeccable! The rooms were clean and better than what I expected from the pictures. Oh, and the beds and pillows were so comfortable! We used their catering service at Buckingham's for a couple of events and Joe and his staff were wonderful and accommodating. They put extra care and detail into making sure our events were a success. Even the bartender was a very cool and laid back guy. Our family really enjoyed staying here and we are so thankful for such a great experience with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “All Star Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Staceyleesoldan
Reviews.Content: I travel for my job so we used reward points to stay here for a baseball tournament. We did not stay in the 'Towers" part of the hotel, but in the other section of the hotel which has exterior entry. This is a large hotel and there is security on site. We felt very safe! When we checked in it was late in the afternoon and busy, but the staff was quick in getting us to our room and made sure we had a rollaway bed in our room. The rooms had a fridge, microwave & were average size. The hotel has a good sized outdoor pool & hot tub with a large sitting area that stays open until midnight...there is also a smaller indoor pool & hot tub. You also get a free buffet at the restaurant next door and it will fill you up. A plus for us was the availability of laundry on site. We had a problem with the laundry soap vending machine working and when I went to the front desk to inquire she said she would send someone down to the room to meet me and one of the staff was waiting on me when I returned from the front desk! Everything is clean here...this not a new hotel, but is well maintained...you see staff working on landscaping and overall maintenance every day on the day we left they were unpacking new chairs. What sets the facility apart from others is the STAFF from the front desk to housekeeping they are friendly and accommodating! Everyone associated with this hotel has a can do attitude! I would recommend this facility to anyone…good location and great staff is hard to beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Branson's Best”
Reviews.Author: Bart4IV
Reviews.Content: We (4 people) arrived in Branson June 22, 2012 and stayed at the Clarion 2 nights. We arrived at about 2 pm that Friday, check-in was very easy. The staff was very nice and very helpful. I did have one problem with the room key not working, but they got it taken care of. They were great, this was no big deal.. At check-in they gave us vouchers for a free breakfast buffets at Sadies Restaurant right next door. The buffet was awesome, probably not the best breakfast in Branson, but we approved. Sadies had live music while we ate breakfast both mornings. Great. For the 4 of us, the breakfast was easily a $100 value. For the 2 weekend nights, 1 bedroom w/ balcony, 2 queen beds, 4 people, it was $270 dollars. I think it is a great value when you include the free breakfast. The grounds were spotless, the lobby was spotless, the rooms were spotless, and the pool area was spotless. Plenty of parking. It is located in the heart of Branson, you are in walking distance of shops, restaurants, and shows. Traffic is horrible, so that is nice. The room had two queen beds that were very comfortable. The pillows were the best. The bathroom was very clean, plenty of towels for the four of us. Room had a frig, microwave, and cable TV. It was late June, the temps were at about mid 90's. I put the A/C on high, cool, and the room was extremely cold, the way I like it. It got so cold, we had to turn it down. If I did have one complaint, it would be that the Oasis Bar is a little high in price on drinks, $15 for a crown and coke (horrible price). Drink elsewhere. Other than that, this stay was an very good experience. Thank you Branson Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “Bad a/c but the staff was quick to move us”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: Our ac didn't work properly the first night. Luckily we had a room with a balcony and could open the door to cool off. The staff moved us to a new room the following morning. Rooms are nice. Staff is great. The balcony's overlook either the "strip" or the resort style pool. Love the pool. You can walk from the pool to the restaurant bar to get a drink and bring it back to the pool area. This hotel has two pools. One outdoor and one indoor, plus a hot tub outdoors. The restaurant, Buckingham's, has excellent prime rib!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are great. We had a king room with a balcony. The beds are very comfortable with just the right softness. You get plenty of soft pillows also. I also like that the vanity area is outside the bath. You get a full breakfast buffet next door at Sadie's restauant. You will get coffee included but any other drinks are not included. It is a good buffet and so much better than continental. The outdoor pool area is verynice. We had no trouble with parking. We were able to park in the front every night which was very nice. We have stayed in several other hotels in Branson but this one has been the best. We will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here over a week. We went to Branson to celebrate our 40th Wedding Ann. Beds were very comfortable! Rooms clean! Very reasonable price too! Breakfast came with the room at Sadie's Sideboard next door. Good food but the breakfast is the same every day so you might need a break. Sadie's had entertainment every morning too! Beautiful hotel & grounds & pool! Also a laundry where you can wash & dry your clothes. They even put congratulations on our 40th on the lighted sign in front of the hotel! I look forward to staying here when we return to Branson, MO.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: arpsigk
Reviews.Content: I am the planer for a Military Reunion each year and we have meet in Branson for the past 7 years. This was our first time to stay at the Clarion. It was neat and clean, the staff were all courteous and helpful especially Joe Luna (Semper Fi) and his wife who took care of our Hospitality Room and meet our ever need. We will be returning next year to the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “diffult for handicaped”
Reviews.Author: tird
Reviews.Content: We went to the clarion may of 2012.They only had 1 handicaped parking out front which we were only able to get 1 time.The hotel is on a hill and if you park in the back you have a long way to walk.My husband complained to the management and they told us we could park at a resturant next to hotel.But it was still on a incline.So i would have to let my husband out of car and then go park.You have to go to the restaurant next door to hotel for your breakast.It was good but if you wanted any kind of juice you had to pay a dollar.We wount stay there next time because of the handicapped issue.Everthing else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Larry805
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at the Clarion. It was neat, clean, new-looking. The staff were all courteous and helpful. It was convenient to park and to attractions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: janea54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here October '09 and had a positive experience so we thought we'd try it again. There was a sign in the lobby indicating remodeling was afoot, but that it should not interfere with our stay. I'm not quite sure what is being done, but I detected a wonky smell the second I entered the lobby. Paint? Adhesives? Not sure. Fortunately that smell didn't follow us to the 7th floor "penthouse" suite. I didn't receive the same genuinely warm welcome as our last stay. The clerk seemed more concerned with our license plate number than anything else. I'm pretty easy to get along with, but honestly, this woman impressed me as so not wanting to be there. Oh, the license plate obsession? Apparently, it has to do with parking lot accidents and I suppose people claiming a car had been hit that wasn't even registered. Not 100% sure. Oddly enough, at checkout (when a different clerk was much warmer), indeed a guest had just reported hitting a car in the lot. Kudos to this young man for reporting it; bad news for the hotel employee whose car he had hit. This being said, be aware that this is a very sloped parking lot (particularly at the front of the hotel) and try to park as close to where you can access your room as possible. The penthouse level (7th floor - front building) has 6 rooms, and I don't think one lick of improvement/upgrade had been done since our last visit. An argument could be made that lots of people don't use these rooms I suppose, and it hasn't been needed. But I hope at some point they at least change out the turquoise and white wallpaper which still clashes with the deep red bedspread and valances (I shudder to think a hotel doesn't change out spreads over 2 1/2 years, although it appeared clean and undamaged.) The spa tub in the bedroom rather than the bathroom still sported a dangly artificial plant on its ledge. I suggest removal. Otherwise, the room was clean and quiet, and the mini-fridge and microwave were appreciated. I felt sorry for the guests this particular weekend who were in rooms close to the college students who claimed the outdoor pool area (beer aplenty on the tables). They made their presence known well into the night as well, but 7 floors up, it wasn't troublesome. Regarding the breakfast, I don't know it Sadie's next door is a temporary or permanent arrangement; but I suspect a weekday experience would be more positive. It was fairly crowded the Saturday we were there (passed on it the following day and headed to Bob Evans). The breakfast was satisfactory despite some very greasy bacon (passed on that) and inclusion of only coffee and water (the cheerful and attentive waitress did bring me hot tea at no extra charge). Even continental breakfasts include juice and milk, so this seemed a bit chintzy. The milk by the dry cereal had a stern sign warning not to use the milk for drinking! Ha! Also, we had barely started to eat when a guy started to sing to recorded music! His tip jar was conveniently placed, and he mentioned his cds were available for purchase several times! I know this is Branson, and people are hawking timeshares and such at every turn, but I could've done without this. The hotel still has a desirable location smackdab in the middle of the strip (yes, tornado damage was evident as one drove W from 65...and, yes, traffic still is challenging). Would we stay here next time? Since we don't generally walk along the strip to restaurants and shows, I have to say no. There are too many other places in Branson. A tip: they still try to charge about $2/night for the room safe. Just mention the fee at checkout, and the clerk will cheerfully remove it.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: tes0520
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the hotel for a weekend getaway. The hotel and staff were nice, the room was clean and the location was handy. We booked a king jacuzzi suite. The room was located on the 7th floor with only 5 other rooms. You had to use your room key to get to the floor. It was not accessible by other guests which was nice because apparently there was a college group there that weekend. The police were called twice. I heard other complaints but it was quiet on our floor. My only complaint was the breakfast. You are given vouchers for each morning to next door to Sadie's for a buffet breakfast. Don't expect service with a smile at Sadie's. I felt the staff were overwhelmed with the amount of customers they had. The food was not very good. The food was very greasy, the bacon under cooked, and our hands were sticky by the time we went through the buffet line....and we didn't get pancakes or syrup. We chose not to eat there the second morning. We checked out of the hotel and paid for our breakfast elsewhere. I would have rather had a simple continental breakfast at the hotel. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clarion now has breakfast at Sadie's”
Reviews.Author: 2MOTravelers0102
Reviews.Content: I really like the Clarion because it is clean and walking distance to many items on the strip. Instead of having breakfast at their Buckinghams, they are having their free breakfast at Sadie's which is next door. This was a much better option then Buckinghams. Food was great. Was seated by a hostess. This will definitely make the Clarion one of my tops choices in staying at Branson. Hope they keep this option.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovestogo79
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times before, and have always had an ejoyable stay. When we stayed in March we were given vouchers for Sadies Smokehouse next door for breakfast instead of their usual continental breakfast; which was nice however expect to wait in line, especially on the weekends! During this stay we stayed in the back of the hotel,in a room with 2 queen beds. We have found that the rooms in the back are not as nice as the ones by the lobby. To sum up our last stay, the beds were very comfortable, bathroom was very small, indoor pool area was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: On Feb. 17 2012, we went to the Clarion Hotel Branson, where we usually stay, and had a great visit. Sharon made our check-in and stay very pleasant. And when I saw "Barker" on the sign out front, I thought "is that a new group in Branson that I haven't heard of?" Then I saw "Happy 62nd anniversary, Barkers", and then " Happy Birthday, Dorothy" for our friend with us, I couldn't believe they would do that for us!!! Thank you so much! We had a great time. (There was also a posting for a wedding. I hope they thought the "62nd anniversary" was a good omen) Bill & Betty Barker

Reviews.Title: “Homey!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy D
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed 3 nights and could not have asked for a cleaner, more comfortable hotel. The continental breakfast was amazing and served at the little country diner next to the hotel. The indoor pool and hot tub was great for all of us. Very nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and view”
Reviews.Author: samhill82
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Stayed on the top floor an its a great view from there. Room was well kept and clean. Hair dryer did not work but they promptly brought us another one. We will be going back again as we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Buckingham Restaurant We had a family gathering.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We had my parent's 60th anniversary there. They gave us a private room that was absolutely gorgeous! Joe, his lovely wife and wonderful staff were great! They put together a movie of our parents pictures and put it to music and played it on a large screen. We had so much fun and yet it was very beautiful and low key at the same time. These folks were like family by the end of the night. Our service was excellent. There is no one who could have done a better job to make my parents night one everyone will always remember. If you are thinking of any kind of event in Branson, this is where to be. These folks can make it happen. AAA++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Poor management!!!”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: After posting dirty hot tub,getting a infection in my right hand from said hot tub and which cost me hundreds of dollars and having to cancel rotor cuff surgery that was schulded for the sixth!! I called management to complain and his reply was that they have the city of Branson check weekly that I couldn't have gotten infection from their tub!! I'm sure that it being the holidays that it wasn't tested as frequently as normal? I just wanted to warn them of the problem and felt it fell upon deaf ears? Hope that no one else had the same experience as I did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mssunlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights which included New Year's Eve. The entire experience was awesome. Great price, great room, 2 queens with 2 types of pillows, small balcony with 2 chairs, refrigerator, iron, microwave, hairdryer, wonderful shower head and small safe. Continental breakfast included scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, make your own waffles, cereal, yogurt, pastries / donuts, and fresh fruits, plus all the trimmings. We did not use the indoor pool or hot tub but they were available. Staff was wonderful. Upon check-in, Roger gave us a Branson map, information on using the wi-fi in room, information on ordering reduced price show tickets (which we did and they were delivered) and directions to all amenities in hotel. This was an great experience and we would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again the next time we visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hot tub!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful! We were there for the New years weekend.The hotel and room were clean and the staff was very helpful with our accommodations. We had dinner on New Years eve at the Buckingham with eight o'clock reservations.I'm sorry to say that the buffet was terrible and poorly maintained with over cooked prime rib and everything else was cold! The food was awful and limited supply? I would have walked out if it wasn't new years eve!!! It seemed like we got left overs.Very disappointed with the whole experience!!!! Later that evening our view from our balcony at midnight was excellent as we could observe the fireworks on table rock! The next day after sightseeing I was looking forward to the hot tub and to my surprise it was the dirtiest and coldest tub that I have ever seen!!!! There was nasty brown foam floating on top and I didn't see it until I had gotten in and I could not get out fast enough!! It is such a nice place that it is too bad that these things were overlooked?

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: youngemsa
Reviews.Content: Went to Branson to see the Christmas lights and wanted to stay someplace a little nicer this trip. I read reviews on trip advisor and decided for the money we would try the Clarion. It is on "The Strip" and our room faced the street but we heard no street noise. There was one person checking in ahead of me but the clerk called someone from the back so I had no wait time to check in. The room was very clean, roomy, quiet, and comfortable. We had two kinds of pillows on the bed, down and foam. Most important to me was the showerhead, it was great with plenty of water pressure and different spray settings. They put a copy of your bill under the door during the night so if you have no other charges you can skip the front desk on checkout. The breakfast was great. Biscuits and gravy, waffles, fresh fruit, 3 cereals, eggs, and plenty of staff to keep things full and clean. There is a steakhouse on site, a buffet next door, and a mexican place across the street that is very nice. Yes, as other reviews have mentioned, they have a seperate building with exterior rooms. So if you don't want one of these call ahead for an interior room. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: tmcap
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and roomy. The staff is awesome. The pool was huge and very nice. Every room has a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. Right on hwy 76 so you can walk to different places. I have recommended family and friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Cowboyup47
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Rooms are nice size and clean. Beds were very comfortable. The rooms all have a balcony, which is quite small but room enough for two people. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We did not eat in the resturant. They do provide a full buffet breakfast which was very good. Unfortunately, the breakfast area is a little small for this size hotel, and at least for the two days we were there, it was very crowded due to bus tours. You didn't have to wait too long for a seat however as long as you don't mind eating with strangers. The hotel parking lot is quite steep, but manageable. Overall very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property situated in the heart of Branson”
Reviews.Author: lledford
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable, but so high off the floor there was a step stool. The room also had a balcony overlooking the pool area. We did not spend much time in the room or the hotel, but our experience was good. Breakfast was located in a separate bulding where a very nice restaurant Buckingham's is located. The buffet was very good and had a real full breakfast. My only complaint was the lack of good parking. Branson is a very hilly place with lots of steep grades. This was the case with the Clarion. Overall this is a very nice hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Restaurant. Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: irving s
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was very nice. Clean, well equipped bath, comfy bed. The restaurant, Buckingham’s was fantastic - make a reservation for a private room for two. Get a bottle of wine. BUT, the front desk staff was horrible. While they do offer shuttle to and from School of the Ozarks Airport, you better arrange in advance. Even when I did, Sharon at the front desk said she would contact the driver “as soon as she could”. Driver showed up after 40 minute wait. When checking in, wife and I waited for Sharon to have a conversation with the cleaning staff about something non-hotel related. Then, it was hard to converse with Sharon because the other desk gentleman was talking so loudly on the phone. Again, later I needed directions from the desk and Sharon was just too busy to help. Actually, she was rude. The day before we left, I let Sharon know that I would be needing a shuttle to the airport. She said that would be hard to do because I needed to make those arrangements in advance. “Yes, that’s why I’m requesting the shuttle now, for tomorrow. I also let you know this when I made room reservations, by phone, two weeks ago, and it was you that I spoke with.” “Well, I’ll see what I can do, but I’m busy.” This lady, Sharon, must be related to the owner, otherwise, she wouldn’t be there! There was another incident with the front desk that I witnessed while waiting and waiting for the shuttle. But, I’ll save you the pain. I will say, the staff handled that incident very inappropriately. I will be back, because the room, restaurant, location and price are very attractive, however, the front desk was not.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: NoBS09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a positive experience and I want to get that message out there. Initially had some concern because some of the reviews I read on this site..so not true. Great service, very clean, comfy beds, nice breakfast, nice pools, perfect location in the heart of activity, and a fairly good price. Concierge helped us find a mechanic to work on our van brakes. Our safe needed new batteries, someone came to replace immediately (we were charged a safe fee of 1.67 that i objected to and the kindly removed it-they had said that "clarion usually charges this fee??"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sojournaler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls' night out, and had a great experience. First, the location is ideal for exploring the Branson "strip" (Hwy 76). It was too cold to walk places, but in warmer weather, one could certainly do so. Second, the staff was very friendly and accomodating. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and we really enjoyed the pool/hot tub area. Last, the hot breakfast was outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: texasrose777
Reviews.Content: rooms are clean and nice furniture...excellent pillows and mattresses.....tv reception is not so good and they use old style poor quality tv's....really nice simple breakfast...all the staff were really nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with comfortable beds great outdoor pool area and great free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Zimfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and really loved this hotel. The beds are super comfortable, the free breakfast included eggs (not rubbery!), biscuits and gravy, waffles, cereals, bagels, etc. The outside pool area is super nice with fake palm trees and a fountain in the middle. They also have numerous lounging chairs around the pool. There is an indoor pool which we didn't use because we really liked the outside pool. There are two sections to this hotel - the older section has the small balconies but they are also the inside rooms which I think are better. The other section is newer but the rooms are outside rooms. The property is kept very clean as are the rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel. There is also a restaurant there which we didn't eat at but it looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: texasredtop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is aging but still is very comfortable, clean and has fresh donuts on their breakfast bar. The rate I pay with my Choice Privileges membership is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Oldfashionpreacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and the price was better than I could get after using points with a hotel card. We were a little uncertain because we had never been to Branson before but decided to take the chance. We were not disappointed with this hotel. Everything was good and the staff was great. If we had a desire to return to Branson we would certainly stay at this hotel again. As a side note, the stuff about the parking is all true. It is very bad in the front with a steep hill but the saving grace is that it has some parking in the back with an entrance from the rear also.

Reviews.Title: “great stay - Very clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: scubadive2
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night here on our way to another town. I used my reward points and was given an excellent room. It was very clean, very comfortable bedding, in-room safe, microwave, coffeemaker, frig. iron, with a balcony that overlooked the outdoor pool. I did not use either the outdoor or indoor pool or fitness room but all looked inviting. We did eat at the onsite restaurant and the dinner was excellent. The employees at the front desk went above and beyond helpfulness and friendliness. This was our first stay at this hotel but it will not be our last!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: arfrogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was as expected in a hotel , but the restaurant here has the best food anywhere. We had diner on our second night and it was excellent, the steak was tender, everything was fresh and just delicious, excellent food at this restaurant . The staff in the restaurant was very attentive to our needs and service was fast. .Amber is the best!! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone planing to stay in Branson you wont be disappointed!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JoyaDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: Almost "old world" in tradition, the Clarion is located within walking distance of a lot of the music theatres. Their restaurant, Buckingham's is the best we tried in Branson. But skip the lunch buffet next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: nyletak
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for a very reasonable price. OUr reservation was only one day ahead of time yet we still got a great room at a great price. The hotel had great pools and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Quiet and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Zender33
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Saturday, August 29th. We rode in on bicycles and the staff made us feel at home. Room 305, which overlooks the outdoor pool, was clean, quiet and comfortable for two. The room wasn't huge but the bed was comfrtable with plenty of pillows, breakfast buffet was included, and the location convenient for walking to attractions. For the money, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: c7silvers
Reviews.Content: The Clarion at the Palace in Branson, Mo. was a very nice hotel. We had a balcony room overlooking the pool. Wow! Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Annex is not good”
Reviews.Author: luvstravlin
Reviews.Content: Spoke to the front desk 2 weeks before arrival based on trip advisor reviews. Was assured I was in the main building. Got here and had a room in the back annex. Said they were sold out & couldn't move me. Apparently nobody put a note on my reservation. Getting to the room with your luggage is a terrible inconvenience unless you want to carry it up stairs. (We are 2 senior women.) The room is comfortable and clean. The beds are very comfortable. But the bathroom is positively claustrophobic. I'm 5'3" and I felt close to the ceiling. It's hard to close the door from inside. The floor space not covered by toilet and tub is about 2'x2' and that's where the door opens. If I were a large person, I would probably have to step into the tub to close the door! The doors open onto an outdoor walkway, so you hear everyone walk by the room. The food and service in the restaurant Buckinghham's were not good either. All in all, I expected more from a Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rinnys
Reviews.Content: My family (we have 3 children ages 6-16) and I stayed here on our latest vacation. We go to Branson at least once or twice a year but this was our first time to stay at the Clarion. I was very pleased. The location is excellent. It is right across the street from the Baldknobbers and Cakes and Cream (great place to get an after show snack) and very close to several restaurants. It's located right on the strip (which can be a good or bad thing, depending on the volume of traffic). We stayed in the main building with a balcony facing the strip. My kids loved sitting out there and watching the traffic. It has two very nice pools. One outdoor and one indoor. The outdoor was a little more crowded, so we went to the indoor pool the most. They both have a good size pool and hot tub. However, the indoor pool also has a sauna. Very clean rooms (this is extremely important to me) and the room was spacious. We had double queen beds and had to have a roll-away, and we still had plenty of room. Like others have said, the bathroom was a little small, but not as bad as I figured reading some of the reviews. Beds were very comfortable. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again. It seems like some of the lower reviews are from people that stayed in the outside building. I can't speak for it, but the main building is great. (Didn't try the restaurant, so can't comment on it)

Reviews.Title: “The Place To Stay In Branson”
Reviews.Author: uctravlers
Reviews.Content: This was our very first trip to Branson MO. We had done our research on where to stay and The Clarion at the Palace is the place. Friendly, clean, nice, good pools, good breakfast just to name a few. I would recommend this place with or without children. The in house resturant ( Buckinghams ) is a good place to eat. Overall, very nice, ask for deals and have a room in the North Tower which is closest to the Hwy 76. Thanks Clarion @ the Palace for a great stay. Hope to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back for sure”
Reviews.Author: lena2350
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel for us. Friendly clean and nice beds. Loved the indoor outdoor pools and hot tubs. Pool in back and not on main strip which is nice. Good breakfast. No complaints and will come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony rooms are great, but the north tower "motel" rooms are not!”
Reviews.Author: fisher004
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past two years. Both of these stays were in the tower facing highway 76, and were hotel (indoor corridors), balcony rooms. We loved these rooms and looked forward to staying again. I booked online and requested a balcony room well ahead of our travel date. When we arrived, there were two busloads of teenagers. I asked if we were on the same floor as the teenagers. The answer was no, they were in a different building. In addition to the tower with balconies, there is a very large, 4-story building behind this one, but with outdoor corridors, motel style. I assumed the teens would be in that building, and we were in the balcony rooms. As my travel partners unloaded the van, the clerk told me to stop them, that we were in the building behind the main one (the motel building), and the huge group of teens were in the main building. We were not happy, since I specifically requested a balcony room, but decided to make the best of it. The clerk proceeded to tell us to drive around back, stop at the entrance to the other building, go in and get a cart to unload (which is about 50 feet from the door), take the cart up the elevator to the 4th floor, then to the room. This entrance is very cramped, with a sharp turn to get to the elevator. Driving the luggage cart down the hill to load the car, then back up, through the small lobby, and around the corner to the elevator is no easy task. Once you are on the floor, it is even harder to get the cart out of the elevator landing and onto the very, very small outside walkway to get to your room. The luggage cart and the maid's cart most definitely do not both fit, and when were leaving, the maid had to completely back her cart into another room to let us pass. She did not act too happy about having to interrupt her cleaning to do this. I would imagine this happens to her many, many times a day. When we got to our room, I found a hair on the sheets, but otherwise it seemed clean. The bathroom area with the toilet and tub shower are the smallest I have ever seen in this nice of a hotel. TINY!! A large man would most definitely NOT be comfortable in this small room. The lavatory was outside of the toilet/tub area, and the microwave and coffee tray were both on the sink countertop, which itself was not large, leaving no room for makeup cases, blow dryers, curling irons etc. We ended up turning the microwave sideways and moving the coffee maker. There is not a closet in this room, but instead a large portable wardrobe, which takes up much needed space. I will not stay at this hotel/motel again until they change their online booking to where you can choose a balcony hotel room versus a very small motel room. The price is the same, and this is ridiculous. The motel is very large, and it is a long walk to get to some of these rooms, (probably 15 rooms on each level). I often travel with my elderly mother and we have stayed here in the hotel part, but she could not make the walk to a room in the motel section. It is very small and very, very inconvenient. Unless you call the hotel directly and confirm you will have a balcony room I do NOT recommend staying here. On a positive note, the beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Always”
Reviews.Author: vacaRus
Reviews.Content: We always in enjoy this hotel! The staff are always helpful and very friendly! The beds, temp., pillows, are comfortable, rooms and pool area are extremely clean! It is close to many things we can walk to. We like that they have a fridge and microwave. They offer a crib if you need. We don't hear our neighbors or the traffic. We have stayed elsewhere before this hotel, but after staying there, will not stay anywhere else. The only bad thing would be the parking, but not bad enough to stop staying there. It is a little more pricey, but then "you get what you pay for" applies. Breakfast is great, but ends a little too early.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra when so much is available”
Reviews.Author: KCwoman
Reviews.Content: The bathroom is tiny. The room was okay in size, but not worth the price they charge. My husband ended up in the hospital and I asked them about a sympathy rate for extra days, and they quoted me a price $20 higher than we were already paying. I moved the family to Branson Inn, which had a hospital rate of $25 and was older, but actually nicer than the Clarion. We had centipedes and spiders in our room and heaven knows what other bugs at the Clarion. I wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds I have ever had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ace9-8-98
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good service, and the most comfortable beds!!! I will stay here everytime I return to Branson, MO.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladynewyorker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days and would highly recomend this Hotel. Room spacious, very clean and service up to our standards. Only drawback is. Parking is on a hill and if you are a senior with trouble walking you may find it to be difficult. Spouse could drive car to hotel entrance for pick up and drop off. Would stay here again. Staff very courteous and helpful . We are seniors ourselves. (only two handicap parking spaces available)

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected, & we won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: okiegirl76
Reviews.Content: I'm hesitant to make reservations online since I can't see the property in person & decide if it "looks" like a nice place. Not wanting to risk getting to town & finding "No Vacancies" (Been there...done that...don't want to do it again.) I did my research before booking by reading the reviews. I choose the Clarion for 2 reasons. First, it was one of only 2 hotels I could find that had a fridge & microwave in the double queen rooms. (The other being the Clarion's sister hotel Comfort Inn & Suites. We would be traveling with a 3 year old, so a fridge was my main priority in looking for a room since I thought it would be beneficial for milk & juice.) Secondly, the Clarion seemed to have good reviews & the pictures looked really nice. When you book online there is a space to make any special requests. I requested a "room with a balcony". I understood that the request was not a guarantee, & that the request would not be viewed by hotel staff until our check-in. When we checked in, the lady at the front desk didn't even acknowledge our request. (No, we didn't get a balcony.) It would have been nice for her to at least mention that she noticed we wanted a balcony, but they didn't have any balcony rooms available. Instead she proceeded to give us all of our info papers & the map of the property. She told us we were in the "North tower" & that we needed to drive around back to get to our room. I assumed the "North tower" was just like the main building w/ indoor corridor room access & would have balconies too. WRONG. I was disappointed to find that the "North tower" was just a normal looking motel w/ outside walkways & room access. Nothing at all like the photos posted on the Clarion website. Nowhere did I ever see a photo of the "North tower". It wasn't a big deal that we didn't get a balcony because I knew not all rooms would have them, but I did think the entire hotel would have indoor access (which I prefer), so that annoyed me. Also, I don't think the rooms in the "North tower" should cost the same as the rooms in the main building. We used the AARP discount, so maybe everyone who gets a discount or uses a coupon gets kicked back to the "North tower". I don't know, but online there is no indication that the buildings have different rates regardless of discounts or coupons. The room itself was about what I expected. We typically stay in mid-grade hotels, so this room was about typical to what we're used to. The big complaint was the bathroom size. It was the SMALLEST (& I do mean SMALL) bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel room. I noticed some others had commented on the bathroom size before I booked, but I didn't think it could be that bad. I was wrong. It was annoying. You could barely close the door without bumping the toilet. If you had the bathmat on the floor & then tried to open or close the door it would scrunch up the bathmat because there wasn't even enough clearance. Another annoyance was that there was not an ice machine on our floor (4th), so you had to go up or down 1 floor to get ice. The outdoor walkway was so narrow that if the maid had her cart out it was difficult to get past especially if you were carrying luggage. It would have been impossible to get by with the luggage cart. There was only 1 elevator at one end of the walkway, so if you couldn't get past the maid's cart with your luggage you'd have to take the stairs at the other end of the walkway. I will give them credit for having comfortable beds & pillows. No complaints there. The pillows & comforter were down which I considered a little more "up-scale" than most hotel bedspreads & pillows in this price range. Housekeeping did a good job re-stocking the towels, tissue, & soap. No complaints there either. Breakfast was average. Nothing fabulous, but they did have some "warm options" if you didn't want just donuts or fruit. We didn't use the restaurant, pools, or gym facilities so I have no comment on them. Also, while some may enjoy being on the "strip" & within walking distance of some restaurants & theaters, that really wasn't a big selling point to us. We didn't walk anywhere, & in the future I would prefer not to be in the middle of the hustle & bustle. All in all it wasn't a terrible experience, but we won't be back to the Clarion. I'm sure of all the hotels in Branson we can find something as good or better for the money that's not on the "strip".

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: interviewtraveler
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it looked so pretty on the outside. Fortunately, the rooms were quite nice too. The beds are plush and elevated, and most rooms have a balcony, which is nice. Overall, the room seemed clean. There's a decent-looking gym, but I didn't get a chance to use it. The continental breakfast was located in the hotel restaurant with plenty of room. In addition to the usual breakfast pastries and cereal, they also have a waffle maker as well as scrambled eggs and biscuits and gravy, all of which made an adequate breakfast. The location is right in the middle of the touristy Branson stuff, which is convenient. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room!”
Reviews.Author: candykAR
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 2 teenage sons, who loved the pool and hot tub areas. They could use an arcade room. The outside access to our 4th floor room seemed daunting when we arrived, but since it is on a hill you start out on the 2nd floor when climbing the stairs with all those suitcases! There was an elevator, but I decided I needed the excerise anyway! The room was very clean- a big deal to me since I have allergies! Beds were somewhat hard, and bathroom was tiny, but hey, one at a time and we lived. Kids loved the larger than normal TV with video hook ups for the game they brought with them. I was susprised that our "average" double room had a small firdge, and a microwave, besides the usual coffee pot, hair dryer and iron. Accomadations were not new, but still nice. Floor was extra clean too. I was imperssed with the quietness of the room even though the hotel seemed really busy --great soundproofing! Lobby complimentary coffee was awesome(BUNN), and the free breakfast was good...OK the waffles were good, the rest so so. Overall we had a great stay....but next time we will get 2 rooms so my night owl kids can stay up late and sleep in, and Dad and I can go to bed at 11, get up at 8 and not wake each other up constantly, ha. Location in the middle of the stip and close to Tanger Mall was AWESOME! Staff were all very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cardsfan19
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through my company's employee discount program, so I got a great rate for the room. Was a little leary when we pulled in and saw that a lot of the rooms in the back had outside access only, but we I checked in, we were given a ground floor room just outside the outdoor pool. The room was very nice, 2 queen beds, frig, microwave, small balcony overlooking pool. The only drawback was the small bathroom, but that was really wasn't a big deal. The indoor pool was nice and the hot tub felt great after a long day of go-carts, laser tag & mini golf with the kids. The staff was more than helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend the Clarion to anyone and I will stay here the next time we're in Branson.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ft. Lost in the Woods MO
Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: mommatofour
Reviews.Content: We took our family of 6 (4 kids) to Branson for a week and chose this hotel. I was not disappointed! Our kids ages, 11,10,4 and 2 all had a great time. They enjoyed both pools. My only complaints would be this: They need to hire someone to monitor the outdoor pool. The fountain in the middle was an open invitation for some kids to climb on and jump off(despite a number of warnings from employees passing by). Also they seemed to like to put their hands over the spout so that when they released them the water would shoot out harder. This got to be quite annoying, since my 2 and 4 year old both dont like water in their faces. It made it impossible for us to enjoy the outdoor pool as much as we would have liked to. Perhaps I am to strict with my children, but I thought the parents were a little to preocupied to really care what their kids were doing and who they might be bothering. Also, on our 3rd morning there we were pretty much forced to carry our breakfast back to our rooms.(It was that or eat outside in the heat) They had a conference booked and the breakfast room that was so big and acomidating on our first 2 mornings, was now only big enough to serve about 50 people. I would suggest that if they want to hold conferences there that they build a different building specifically for that purpose. Other then those two things, I really cant complain. My husband is military so we got the military rate, which is awesome compared to others we priced! Our room, while not huge, was big enough for the 6 of us. When you think about it, your only there to sleep right? The hotel was right in the middle of everything. The rooms were clean and well supplied. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful! My husband and I both enjoyed the small balcony, and it was great for hanging our towels to dry. Since our room had a fridge and a microwave we went to the local Walmart and grabbed some cheap soft drinks and snacks. The selection on the televison channels is not huge, and if you have younger kids they may be disappointed that there is no Disney channel. I know mine were. But we kept them pretty busy and tired so they didnt notice after that first morning! One thing I would suggest if you have a bigger family is Papa Grands pizza buffett. We ate there for under 30 dollars and that was with drinks as well. It is only about a mile or so from the hotel. All in all this a great hotel to stay at. I would recommend it and will stay again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Clarion!”
Reviews.Author: mom9801
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Clarion hotel in Branson July 30th to August 1st, 2008 . We loved this hotel and will definitely stay again. The location is great--right on the 76 strip. Having 2 kids, we really appreciated how large our room was. Included with the standard 2 queen room is a microwave and fridge, which is also a huge plus with kids. We enjoyed our balcony. We were on the 5th floor, so our view was fantastic. The indoor pool was nice, but we really enjoyed the fabulous outdoor pool. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean, and the beds very comfy. The extra pillows were a nice touch, too. Overall a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy At Clarion Once Again”
Reviews.Author: Bobaron
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 night stay at the Clarion. This is our 2nd stay and we are just a pleased as the first time. Our room was very clean. The hotel staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. The kids enjoyed the pool as did my husband and myself. The breakfast is very good. We walked over to Sadies one morning and we really regretted it. We thought it was terrible and the place was pretty dirty. we will not return to Sadies. From now on we will stick with breakfast at the Clarion. We will definately return to the Clarion in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: funodyssey
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great from the outside, good location and the kisd liked the pool. The main building looked great, but we were giving a room in the building located separate and behind the main building. Breakfast was below average, the kids had difficulty eating it. Bathroom was tiny,tiny. The sheets were DIRTY on our second date, we were told they are washed every other day. How can a guess tell the soiled sheets are from your own kids, or from another guess

Reviews.Title: “overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydkelnol
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with our 3 small children. The Clarion overall is an excellent hotel. It was very clean, nothing fancy, but very comfortable. It had comfortable beds and plenty of pillows. The 2 pools and hot tubes were great, and very clean as well. The breakfast was average for hotels. The only complaint I have was the shower head was very low, I am only 5' 5" and I had to duck down to get under the water. My husband is very tall and had a hard time taking a shower. We stayed in the North tower overlooking the pool, which had a nice balcony and great view. I have not stayed at very many hotels in Branson, so I might try something else the next time, but would defintely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice”
Reviews.Author: PugMom13
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We stayed in The President's Suite on the 5th floor. A very clean and big room that has a balcony with seating for two. Two TV's, a flat screen one in the suite with sofa and lounge chair and one by the bed. Lots of space to put your clothes. There is very little counter space in the vanity area. The bathroom was small but had those nice curved shower rods and a nice showerhead. Bathroom was super clean. Service was friendly and polite, housekeeping did a nice job everyday. The free breakfast was nice too, waffles and scambled eggs were the hot items that were served along with donutes, bagels, fruit etc. Plenty to eat. The pool is very nice. The hotel could use more upright seating at the pool, the louge chairs were uncomfortable for me. Both the indoor pool and exercise room looked clean and nice, but I did not use them. Lots of parking in the back of the hotel. Easy to get out onto the main road. Traffic is terrible in Branson, so allow plenty of time to get to shows. A terrific 50's style diner is right next door to the hotel (in a Victorian Village) that has singing waiters/wairtress's that is a really fun place to eat. Buckingham's in the hotel is decorated in the jungle theme, pretty but was overpriced, the food being of good quality but I did not care for what I ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: harleyglide
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels we ever stayed at,a true gem in branson!!Clean as a whistle with a great location near Presleys and the Hobnobbers music shows two of the best shoes in branson.Most of the parking lots are on hills so be prepared but i had no problem parking.Real nice pool area indoor and outdoor,great lil continetal wakeup breakfast. A real nice place with great wait staff glad i choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my all-time favorites”
Reviews.Author: kenn6174
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Branson for a meeting and one of my staff members booked our rooms at this hotel. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years and this will always be one of my favorites. It's hard to describe as it has been decorated by the owners (owned and operated by a family that lives in Branson) and the decor is unique and very nice but the overall feel is one of having visited a favorite aunt and uncle or grandma. Not that the decor is dated -it's not. It's just that the hotel has a very "homey" feel - down to the fluffy bath mats in the bathrooms and the cozy room off of the lobby where you can watch television or grab a cup of coffee that's brewing 24/7. The pool area is lovely (there's an indoor and outdoor pool) and they have a very nice fitness center. Although I didn't go to the restaurant, the menu was amazing. The whole place is immaculate. The staff was very friendly and you got the feeling that most of them had been with the hotel for years. The rooms are very nice and the beds are extremely comfortable. I am very picky about hotels as I've worked in the hospitality industry for more than 25 years so I notice everything. Whether you are in Branson for business or pleasure, I'd recommend this hotel without reservation. After having stayed there once, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Took Eight Tries to get off the Icy Parking Lot”
Reviews.Author: LovelyMiss
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Branson on church business. I booked us into the Clarion because it looked to be the best deal at a modest price {$70/day}. I liked that it included free wireless internet and a complimentary breakfast every day. I was not disappointed. The whole town was shut down for the winter, so the traffic was minimal. The hotel had just reopened its restaurant. My husband rated his dinner the best prime rib he has ever tasted. The internet was great. The shower head was invigorating. The TV was bright red and orange, and hard to see. The staff was pleasant and cheerful. The biggest issue was trying to get off the parking lot. The lot slopes steeply down to the hotel from Route 76. There was an ice storm that was predicted for over 24 hours, yet the lot was left untreated, and a glaze about a quarter-inch thick covered everything. As we made one attempt after another in our rental car {picture the little engine that could}, we observed some hotel employees scattering handfuls of something in various spots on the parking lot. Too late to help us! Plus we came dangerously close to sliding into one of the men who seemed to ignore that we were unable to steer away from him. We had to keep trying because we had to make our flight or risk being iced in. Well, it all worked out, they stopped the flights AFTER we got out of Springfield. Winter in Branson is a whole other experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bushlamo
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at a rival hotel chain when visiting Branson, but decided to try the Clarion at the Palace, and we're glad we did! Booked king-size rooms via the website, check-in was easy and smooth, and the rooms were very nice--almost a mini-suite. Everything was clean, pleasant and very appealing. The indoor pool and hot tub were a welcome respite as the outside temperature was hovering around 20 degrees. The on-site restaurant was not open (presumably because of the season), however, the included breakfast buffet was quite nice, and included biscuits and gravy, waffles, bagels, doughnuts, fruit, boiled eggs, juices, cereals, etc. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient, pleasant hotel to use while visiting Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: carol9193
Reviews.Content: Planed on staying one night place was so nice that we stayed for four more nights had no trouble getting the extra nights. breakfast was great. The lady who cleaned our room was very helpful. Everyone was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Heloise
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson together. We stayed here November 9-11, 2007. It was a very good experience and we could find no fault with the hotel. We booked through the hotel website, which turned out to be cheaper than booking with an online agency, such as Expedia or Orbitz. The room was very nice with a private balcony, as well as a microwave and mini refrigerator. There were plenty of big, fluffy towels and a nice fluffy bathmat. The breakfast is fine for those who want something like muffins, cereal, donuts, etc. We chose to eat at the Hard Luck Diner, which is next door. The prices are good and they have singing servers. Buckingham's Restaurant was fabulous. We would like to compliment our server, Hana. She was excellent. The food was freshly cooked and worth the wait. We had a lovely meal in a private booth. The wine and food is fairly priced and high quality. For those who prefer all you can eat and burgers and fries - go elsewhere. There are plenty of choices a few steps from the hotel. We did not use the indoor/outdoor pools or jacuzzi but they looked great and were quite large, as hotel pools go. There is also a lounge off the lobby with complimentary coffee and a computer with internet access. The hotel also has 24 hour security.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Pathleader
Reviews.Content: Very good beds, pool is large and staff is friendly. Only problem is the deluxe breakfast is not deluxe. It is just waffles, cold hard boiled eggs and no fruit. We went else where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient, Buckingham's restaurant not so great”
Reviews.Author: BGandFamily
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend trip with the wife and kids (ages three and seven) from KC to Branson for a quick getaway last weekend. Rode the "Ducks", go-karts, and had a great time at the Landing. Nighttime light and music show is super. The real show was the "Buckets and Boards" street performance team though. Stick around if you see these two guys setting up! Our room at the Clarion was great. Clean, fairly quiet, and no smell of smoke anywhere. Even though we were close to the lobby, access to the pool and exercise room was convenient. Kids had a blast in the outdoor pool and hot tub. Didn't have time to spend any time at the indoor pool though. I would definitely stay here again. Only gripe I have is with the attached Buckingham's restaurant. With two kids, the dinner service was unbearably slow (over an hour before any food was presented). When our steaks came out, they were lukewarm. Not undercooked--just had been sitting on a counter somewhere for way too long. Coming from Kansas City I'm used to at least a little bit of "sizzle" when my ribeye comes out of the kitchen. Not even a little steam on this one. Probably the worst $100 meal I've had in recent memory. Go to Sadie's buffet next door--best country cookin' you'll find, and it costs next to nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it with one exception”
Reviews.Author: tird
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days this July.We took our 9 year old Grandson.This was a first stay for us.We enjoyed are stay and will stay again.The rooms were clean and they had a great air conditioner I like my room cold.I asked if they could have the air conditioner on when we arrived as I have a medical condition and the heat bothers me.I hate going into a room that is hot, then you have to go somewhere to let the room cool off.But the air conditioner was on and it was nice and cool in the room.The pools are great and you can go at any time and swim.I have stayed at other hotels where they closed the pool early but not here.I loved being able to hang our wet bathing suiets on the balcony to dry I hate haveing them in the bathroom they never get dry.The halls smelled so good except a few days and I could smell cigarette smoke, where it use to be a smokeing establishment.You cant smoke in your rooms but people do at the pool and on there balconies.The brekfast was good but after 3 days you get a little sick of the same thing .They served doughnuts,cereal, biscuits and gravy.You could make your own waffles which were very good.They had fruit and of course your usually juices.I was dissapointed in the TV selection.They didnt carry that many stations and when we werent going to a show or swimming there was nothing to watch.My Grandson was borried with the cartoon channel which was all they had for children.You also can order food from the oasis restaurant and eat pool side which my Grandson enjoyed.The only staff that was rude was the man working in the oasis restaurant.He could use some instructions in being cordial.I liked being close to the shows and we walked to 2 ot them from the hotel.All in all we loved it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KayGeePC
Reviews.Content: If you want no frills clean and comfortable, this is it. Get the full Branson experience because this hotel is in the center of it all .. We walked to the Baldknobbers Hillbilly Show which was very entertaining. This hotel has a free breakfast too, just go early.

Reviews.Title: “Have the best Outside and Indoor pools in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: IndependenceKen
Reviews.Content: We travel to Branson 2-3 times a year and have stayed at a multitude of Hotels. This was one of our most pleasant stays. Our only disappointment was we had reservations for the North Tower and due to a overbooking of rooms had to stay in the South Tower the first night instead. The rooms were OK there however we preferred the other building. The Manager bent over backwards to get us into the North tower the next night since we did prefer the view and the outdoor balcony that these rooms offered. In this building you also have rooms available with King beds and Suites. If you are picky on your pillows and beds, this is the place to stay. We forgot our pillows that we usually bring but were pleased that we did not need them. We also liked the rooms having both a refrigerator and micro waive in them. They were doing some remodeling and putting on a new roof which made it a little inconvenient to get in and out but this was not a major problem and I believe has now been corrected. This was suppose to be a non smoking facility so don't know if some folks were smoking in the hallways or elevators and did not care for that factor however the staff was diligent to try to remedy this. The continental breakfast was above par for Branson and the room was very nice where they had it. They also offered a discount coupon for Sadies next door for a full spread at $2.95 if desired. They had both a great indoor and outdoor pool and thought that the outdoor pool was one of the nicest in Branson. It made you feel more like you were at a resort. We will definitely stay there again and the hospitality was great. The positives by far outweighed any negatives that were incurred during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nonsmoking room smelled like smoke!”
Reviews.Author: WendyMO
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel off of the reviews from Tripadviser. We first stayed at the new Hilton Promenade on Branson Landing and fell in love with this new hotel. When we checked into this hotel, the outdoor pool area looked better than the only indoor Hilton pool, however we were quickly wishing we were back at the Hilton once we were in the rooms. The balconies are nice but my kids thought the room smelled like "puppy chow". There is no option for relaxing in your room and renting a movie- there is no pay movies. Quite disappointing for a family that wanted to watch a movie together. The room wasn't bad, just out dated. The color schemes, bedding and furniture were adequate but nothing to write home about. The bathroom was the worst- the door would not shut all the way- only as far as the middle of the toilet seat. For the little bit more money that the Hilton charges, we went back for the remainder of our stay. We slept so much better and the cleanliness and decor were well worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Hotel at the Palace
HotelInfo.Address: 2820 W Hwy 76, Branson, MO 65615
